NAVAL.Definition: belonging to his country's sea military

STEAM TRAIN.Definition: a train that is powered by an steam engine (the vapour into which water is converted when heated)

SCHOLARSHIP.Definition: payment made to support his education

OUT IN THE OPEN.Definition: in an open space, in the country

UPBRINGING.Definition: education and training received during childhood

DECLINE.Definition: the fact of becoming less powerful

SIEGE.Definition: the situation in which a town or castle is surrounded by enemies

KEEP UP.Definition: make it remain at a high level

DISTRACT.Definition: make them stop giving their attention to

REINFORCEMENTS.Definition: extra troops sent to increase the strength of their army

REWARDED.Definition: given as a recognition for his services

RECRUITS.Definition: people newly enlisted in the armed forces

GO ONE STEP FURTHER.Definition: to do something more, to advance

TEST OUT.Definition: do it as a test to see if or how it works

CAMPING.Definition: the activity of staying in a tent in the country

MASS RALLY.Definition: a meeting of a very large group of people

JAMBOREE.Definition: a large organised meeting that many people go to

CONTROVERSIALLY.Definition: in a way that caused disagreement and arguments

OLD-FASHIONED.Definition: belonging to a time in the past, not modern

MISOGYNIST.Definition: a man who believes men are better than women

SUFFRAGETTE.Definition: a woman who fights for women's right to vote

ABNORMAL.Definition: different from what was expected, not normal

SOCIAL MOBILITY.Definition: the ability of people to change their social status

RITUAL.Definition: a set of actions or words spoken that are performed regularly in the same manner

CEREMONY.Definition: a set of actions or words spoken that are performed on special occasions

DUTY.Definition: something that you have to do as part of a responsibility and because you feel it is the right thing to do

OBEY.Definition: to act according to what you have been asked or according to rules

LEVEL WITH.Definition: at the same level or height as

PALM.Definition: the inside part of the hand

GANG.Definition: group of young people who do activities together

DECENTRALISED.Definition: remote, far from the main centre

CAVEAT.Definition: something that limits what was previously said

JAMBOREES.Definition: large organised meetings that many people go to

OPTIMISM.Definition: the belief that good things will happen

TOTALITARIANISM.Definition: the political system in which people in power have complete control

OPPRESSOR.Definition: a person who practises authority in a harsh and unfair way

REPRESSED.Definition: not being able to express himself as a

MORAL.Definition: relating to standards of behaviour that each person believes in

BANKRUPTCY.Definition: a situation in which an organisation has no money

PAY OUT.Definition: pay a large amount of money

RELIC.Definition: a tradition or system from the past

PHOENIX-LIKE.Definition: having a resemblance to a phoenix (a mythical bird) in the sense of re-appearing and beginning again

TO TAKE PART IN.Definition: to participate in, to be part of
